info.title: HashiCorp Cloud Platform Consul Central
info.description:
This page provides an API reference for the HCP Consul Central API, a RESTful API for the hosted management plane service available through HCP Consul. HCP Consul Central is an interface that centralizes management operations across all of your Consul clusters. It provides global visibility and control for both HashiCorp-managed and self-managed Consul clusters, even when you deploy services in multiple cloud environments and regions.

Refer to the [HCP Consul Central API Overview](/hcp/docs/consul/api) for more information and instructions on how to authenticate and interact with the API.

parameters.name: parent_resource_name
parameters.description: Parent Resource name will be of the form `project/<project_id>`

parameters.name: pagination.page_size
parameters.description:
The maximum number of results per page to return. If the number 
of available results is larger than `page_size`, a `next_page_token` is
returned, which you can use to get the next page of results in subsequent
requests. A value of zero causes `page_size` to be defaulted.

parameters.name: pagination.next_page_token
parameters.description:
Specifies a page token to use to retrieve the next page. Set this parameter to the
`next_page_token` returned by previous list requests to get the next page of
results. If set, `previous_page_token` must not be set.

parameters.name: pagination.previous_page_token
parameters.description:
Specifies a page token to use to retrieve the previous page. Set this parameter to
the `previous_page_token` returned by previous list requests to get the
previous page of results. If set, `next_page_token` must not be set.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: Query param filter: `name` of the cluster

parameters.name: state
parameters.description: Query param filter: `state` of the cluster. This can be combination of `creating`, 'pending', `running`, `disconnected`.

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: Query param filter: `type` of the cluster. This can be combination of `self_managed`, `hcp-managed`.

parameters.name: order_by
parameters.description: Sorts the services based on a field. Allowed fields: `name`, `state`, `created_at`. The value needs to be of the format <{name/state/created_at} {asc/desc}>. For example: `name asc`, `state desc`.

parameters.name: project_resource_name
parameters.description: Project resource name of the project to which the node belongs. Resource name will be of the form `project/<project_id>`

of available results is larger than `page_size`, a `next_page_token` is
returned, which you can use to get the next page of results in subsequent
requests. A value of zero causes `page_size` to be defaulted.

parameters.name: order_by
parameters.description: Sorts the nodes based on a field. Allowed fields: `name`, `partition`, `created_at`, `updated_at` The value needs to be of the format `<Field Name> {asc/desc}` For example: `name`, `partition asc`, `name desc`.

parameters.description: Sorts the services based on a field. Allowed fields: `name`, `health`. The value needs to be of the format `<Field Name> {asc/desc}` For example: `name`, `name asc`, `name desc`.

parameters.name: partition
parameters.description: Query param filter: `partition` of the service.

parameters.name: namespace
parameters.description: Query param filter: `namespace` of the service.

parameters.name: status
parameters.description: Query param filter: `status` of the service. This can be combination of `passing`, `warning`, `critical`, `none`.

parameters.name: kind
parameters.description: Query param filter: `kind` of the service. This can be combination of `typical`, `connect-proxy`, `destination`, `api_gateway`, `ingress_gateway`, `terminating_gateway`, `mesh_gateway`.

parameters.name: in_mesh
parameters.description: Query param filter: whether the service is in the service mesh or not. Possible values: `true` or `false`.

parameters.name: mtls_mode
parameters.description: Query param filter: mTLS mode of the service. Possible values: `permissive`, `strict`.

parameters.name: cluster_ids
parameters.description: Query param filter: `cluster_id` of the service.

parameters.name: query
parameters.description: Search query to filter by. Searches across service `name`, `cluster_id`, `partition`, `namespace`, `sameness_group`, `tags`.

parameters.name: external_sources
parameters.description: Query param filter: `external_sources`. Returns a service when service's external sources overlap with the external sources specified.

parameters.name: cluster_resource_name
parameters.description: Cluster resource name will be of the form `consul/project/<project_id>/cluster/<cluster_id>`

parameters.description: Name of the node on which the service instance resides.

parameters.name: resource_name
parameters.description: Resource name will be of the form `consul/project/<project_id>/cluster/<cluster_id>`

@type.description:
A URL/resource name that uniquely identifies the type of the serialized
protocol buffer message. This string must contain at least
one "/" character. The last segment of the URL's path must represent
the fully qualified name of the type (as in
`path/google.protobuf.Duration`). The name should be in a canonical form
(e.g., leading "." is not accepted).

In practice, teams usually precompile into the binary all types that they
expect it to use in the context of Any. However, for URLs which use the
scheme `http`, `https`, or no scheme, one can optionally set up a type
server that maps type URLs to message definitions as follows:

* If no scheme is provided, `https` is assumed.
* An HTTP GET on the URL must yield a [google.protobuf.Type][]
  value in binary format, or produce an error.
* Applications are allowed to cache lookup results based on the
  URL, or have them precompiled into a binary to avoid any
  lookup. Therefore, binary compatibility needs to be preserved
  on changes to types. (Use versioned type names to manage
  breaking changes.)

Note: this functionality is not currently available in the official
protobuf release, and it is not used for type URLs beginning with
type.googleapis.com.

Schemes other than `http`, `https` (or the empty scheme) might be
used with implementation specific semantics.

code.description: The status code, which should be an enum value of [google.rpc.Code][google.rpc.Code].

message.description:
A developer-facing error message, which should be in English. Any
user-facing error message should be localized and sent in the
[google.rpc.Status.details][google.rpc.Status.details] field, or localized by the client.

details.description:
A list of messages that carry the error details.  There is a common set of
message types for APIs to use.

google.rpc.Status.description:
The `Status` type defines a logical error model that is suitable for
different programming environments, including REST APIs and RPC APIs. It is
used by [gRPC](https://github.com/grpc). Each `Status` message contains
three pieces of data: error code, error message, and error details.

You can find out more about this error model and how to work with it in the
[API Design Guide](https://cloud.google.com/apis/design/errors).

page_size.description:
The maximum number of results per page to return. If the number 
of available results is larger than `page_size`, a `next_page_token` is
returned, which you can use to get the next page of results in subsequent
requests. A value of zero causes `page_size` to be defaulted.

next_page_token.description:
Specifies a page token to use to retrieve the next page. Set this parameter to the
`next_page_token` returned by previous list requests to get the next page of
results. If set, `previous_page_token` must not be set.

previous_page_token.description:
Specifies a page token to use to retrieve the previous page. Set this parameter to
the `previous_page_token` returned by previous list requests to get the
previous page of results. If set, `next_page_token` must not be set.

hashicorp.cloud.common.PaginationRequest.description: PaginationRequest are the parameters for a paginated list request.

next_page_token.description:
This token allows you to get the next page of results for list requests.
If the number of results is larger than `page_size`, use the
`next_page_token` as a value for the query parameter `next_page_token` in
the next request. The value becomes empty when there are no more pages.

previous_page_token.description:
This token allows you to get the previous page of results for list
requests. If the number of results is larger than `page_size`, use the
`previous_page_token` as a value for the query parameter
`previous_page_token` in the next request. The value becomes empty when
there are no more pages.

hashicorp.cloud.common.PaginationRespons.description:
PaginationResponse is the response holding the page tokens for a paginated
list response.

address.title: The IPv4 address range, including prefix in CIDR notation. For example, 172.25.16.0/24

description.description: An optional description of the IP address range.

hashicorp.cloud.consul_cloud_manager_202.description: CidrRange specifies an IP address and prefix in CIDR format.

config.description: Configuration for the cluster. Returned only for HashiCorp-managed clusters on HCP.

region.title: Region where the cluster is deployed

network_config.description: NetworkConfig contains the network to deploy the Consul cluster into.

tier.description: The type of tier this Consul cluster is provisioned as.

dns_names.title: Public and Private DNS names for the cluster

hashicorp.cloud.consul_cloud_manager_202.description: ClusterConfig holds the configuration for a Consul cluster.

Size corresponds to the size of the VM that a cluster is provisioned
with.
These sizes are represented as "t-shirt" sizes, with each corresponding to a specific
instance type depending on the cloud provider.

Tier represents the different groupings of features and cluster settings
and determines the base billing product associated with a cluster resource.

config.description: Configuration for the cluster. Returned only for HashiCorp-managed clusters on HCP.

region.title: Region where the cluster is deployed

datacenter.description:
`datacenter` is the name of datacenter the Consul servers run in. If
not set, a default value of `dc1` is used.

https://developer.hashicorp.com/consul/docs/agent/config/config-files#datacenter

connect_enabled.description: `connect_enabled` flag denotes that the service mesh is enabled on the Consul servers.

acl_enabled.description: `acl_enabled` stores if ACLs are enabled for this cluster or not.

hashicorp.cloud.consul_cloud_manager_202.description: `ConsulConfig` exposes user settable configurations for a Consul cluster.

public.description: `public` is the DNS name pointing to the cluster's public IP addresses.

private.description: `private` is the DNS name pointing to the cluster's private IP addresses.

hashicorp.cloud.consul_cloud_manager_202.description: DNSNames holds all of the cluster's DNS names.

data.title: Contains detailed information about the node

pagination.title: pagination information for the requesting next or previous page

data.title: list of nodes of a cluster

created_at.description: `created_at` is the timestamp when the cluster was first created.

updated_at.description: `updated_at` is the timestamp when the cluster was last updated.

private.description:
`private` indicates if this cluster's instances should be configured in a
non-externally accessible way.

resource_id.description: This parameter is the network resource's `id`.

resource_name.description: This parameter is the network resource's `name`.

ip_allowlist.description: A list of IP addresses used to restrict access to a cluster.

hashicorp.cloud.consul_cloud_manager_202.description: NetworkConfig configures the network of the Consul cluster.

parent_resource_id.title: `resource_id` of the cluster to which the node belongs

parent_resource_name.title: Resource name of the cluster to which the node belongs

cluster_name.title: Name of the cluster to which the node belongs

parent_resource_id.title: resource_id of the cluster to which the node belongs

parent_resource_name.title: resource_name of the cluster to which the node belongs

cluster_name.title: name of the cluster the node is part of

partition.title: name of the partition the node belongs to

service_data.title: service data of all the services running in the node

details.title: details of all service running on a node

tags.title: cumulative tags of all services running on the node

namespaces.title: cumulative namespaces of all the services of the node

service_name.title: service name of the running service

ports.title: different ports of node occupied by the service

pagination.title: Pagination response containing the page tokens for future requests
Pagination response containing the page tokens for future requests
Pagination response containing the page tokens for future requests

cluster_id.title: The unique identifier of the Consul cluster the service is registered with

cluster_resource_name.title: V2 resource name for parent cluster

cluster_resource_id.title: V2 resource id for parent cluster

namespace.description: Namespace where the service is deployed.

partition.description: Partition where the service is deployed.

tags.description: Each instance of a service can have its own tags. At the service level, returns a set of all tags of all service instances.

external_sources.description: Union of all the external sources on the service instances.

connect_native.description: True if the service is connect native, meaning that it does not use an Envoy proxy.

connected_with_proxy.description: True if the service is connected to an Envoy mesh proxy.

transparent_proxy.description: Determines whether service traffic is forced to pass through the sidecar proxy.

connected_with_gateway.description: True if the service is connected to a gateway.

mtls_mode.title:
Represents how external service requests are handled with regards to mutual TLS protocol
Possible values: "", "strict", "permissive"

sameness_group.description: A name defined at the admin partition level to help determine if two services are the same.

cluster_id.title: The unique identifier of the Consul cluster the service is registered with

cluster_resource_name.title: V2 resource name for parent cluster

cluster_resource_id.title: V2 resource id for parent cluster

namespace.description: Namespace where the service is deployed.

partition.description: Partition where the service is deployed.

node.title: Consul node the service is registered on

address.description: Service-specific IP address or hostname. If no value is specified, the IP address of the agent node is used by default.

connected_with_proxy.description: True if the service is connected to an Envoy mesh proxy.

status.title:
Represents overall service instance health status as determined by the highest elevated health check
This can be any of "passing", "warning", "critical", "none"

bearer.description: Authentication token, prefixed by Bearer: Bearer <token>
bearer.name: Authorization
